extendedIngredients.name: roasted red pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons finely chopped roasted sweet red pepper

recipes.title: Individual Italian Frittatas

winePairing.pairingText: Frittatan on the menu? Try pairing with Sparkling Wine. Even if you aren't making mimosas, sparkling wine is great with eggs for two reasons. One, if you're eating eggs early in the day, sparkling wine has less alcohol. Secondly, it cleanses the palate, which is important since yolk is known to coat the palate. One wine you could try is Billecart-Salmon Brut rosé ( Magnum). It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 170 dollars.

productMatches.title: Billecart-Salmon Brut Rose ( Magnum)
productMatches.description: Persistent mousse, with fine bubbles rising slowly. Pale salmon pink in color, with a shade of gold. A nose of red fruits and fresh pear. Delicate fruit on the palate, elegant, and showing great finesse.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small skillet, cook and stir onion in oil over medium heat until tender. Add mushrooms; cook 2-4 minutes longer or until tender. Divide between two greased 8-ounce ramekins. Top with salami and red pepper.                                                                                            In a small bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, Parmesan cheese, parsley, minced chives and pepper; pour into ramekins. Bake at 400° for 10 minutes.                                                                                           Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese; bake 8-10 minutes longer or until eggs are set. Sprinkle with chopped chives if desired.                                        Yield: 2 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Individual Italian Frittatas in  Taste of HomeApril/May 2012, p22                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 ramekin equals 339 calories, 24 g fat (8 g saturated fat), 456 mg cholesterol, 751 mg sodium, 6 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 24 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small skillet, cook and stir onion in oil over medium heat until tender.
Add mushrooms; cook 2-4 minutes longer or until tender. Divide between two greased 8-ounce ramekins. Top with salami and red pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, Parmesan cheese, parsley, minced chives and pepper; pour into ramekins.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese; bake 8-10 minutes longer or until eggs are set. Sprinkle with chopped chives if desired.
